title: torch.expand() bug
body_html:
Literally try the example from docs to repro:

x = torch.Tensor([[1], [2], [3]])
x.expand(-1, 4)

Trace:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: The expanded size of the tensor (-1) must match the existing size (3) at non-singleton dimension 0. at /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1503970438496/work/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensor.c:308

Same thing happens when you try to expand along any other dimension that isn't 0.

Same thing happens when you try to expand along any other dimension that isn't 0.
body:
Literally try the example from docs to repro:

```
x = torch.Tensor([[1], [2], [3]])
x.expand(-1, 4)
```

Trace:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: The expanded size of the tensor (-1) must match the existing size (3) at non-singleton dimension 0. at /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1503970438496/work/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensor.c:308
```

Same thing happens when you try to expand along any other dimension that isn't 0.
